series.description: An array of objects with `name` and `color` keys. Determines which data should be consumed from the `data` array.

type.description: Controls how chart areas are positioned relative to each other, `'default'` by default

withGradient.description: Determines whether the chart area should be represented with a gradient instead of the solid color, `false` by default

curveType.description: Type of the curve, `'monotone'` by default

withDots.description: Determines whether dots should be displayed, `true` by default

dotProps.description: Props passed down to all dots. Ignored if `withDots={false}` is set.

activeDotProps.description: Props passed down to all active dots. Ignored if `withDots={false}` is set.

strokeWidth.description: Stroke width for the chart areas, `2` by default

areaChartProps.description: Props passed down to recharts `AreaChart` component

areaProps.description: Props passed down to recharts `Area` component

fillOpacity.description: Controls fill opacity of all areas, `0.2` by default

splitColors.description: A tuple of colors used when `type="split"` is set, ignored in all other cases. A tuple may include theme colors reference or any valid CSS colors `['green.7', 'red.7']` by default.

splitOffset.description: Offset for the split gradient. By default, value is inferred from `data` and `series` if possible. Must be generated from the data array with `getSplitOffset` function.

connectNulls.description: Determines whether points with `null` values should be connected, `true` by default

children.description: Additional components that are rendered inside recharts `AreaChart` component

withPointLabels.description: Determines whether each point should have associated label, False by default

clickSeriesName.description: Name of the series that was clicked

hoverSeriesName.description: Name of the series that is hovered

highlightHover.description: Determines whether a hovered series is highlighted. False by default. Mirrors the behaviour when hovering about chart legend items

className.description: Class added to the root element, if applicable

style.description: Inline style added to root component element, can subscribe to theme defined on MantineProvider

hiddenFrom.description: Breakpoint above which the component is hidden with `display: none`

visibleFrom.description: Breakpoint below which the component is hidden with `display: none`

lightHidden.description: Determines whether component should be hidden in light color scheme with `display: none`

darkHidden.description: Determines whether component should be hidden in dark color scheme with `display: none`

mod.description: Element modifiers transformed into `data-` attributes, for example, `{ 'data-size': 'xl' }`, falsy values are removed

dataKey.description: Key of the `data` object for x-axis values

referenceLines.description: Reference lines that should be displayed on the chart

withXAxis.description: Determines whether x-axis should be hidden, `true` by default

withYAxis.description: Determines whether y-axis should be hidden, `true` by default

xAxisProps.description: Props passed down to the `XAxis` recharts component

yAxisProps.description: Props passed down to the `YAxis` recharts component

gridProps.description: Props passed down to the `CartesianGrid` component

tickLine.description: Specifies which axis should have tick line, `'y'` by default

strokeDasharray.description: Dash array for the grid lines and cursor, `'5 5'` by default

gridAxis.description: Specifies which lines should be displayed in the grid, `'x'` by default

unit.description: Unit displayed next to each tick in y-axis

tooltipAnimationDuration.description: Tooltip position animation duration in ms, `0` by default

legendProps.description: Props passed down to the `Legend` component

tooltipProps.description: Props passed down to the `Tooltip` component

withLegend.description: Determines whether chart legend should be displayed, `false` by default

withTooltip.description: Determines whether chart tooltip should be displayed, `true` by default

textColor.description: Color of the text displayed inside the chart, `'dimmed'` by default

gridColor.description: Color of the grid and cursor lines, by default depends on color scheme

xAxisLabel.description: A label to display below the x-axis

yAxisLabel.description: A label to display next to the y-axis

withRightYAxis.description: Determines whether additional y-axis should be displayed on the right side of the chart, false by default

rightYAxisProps.description: Props passed down to the YAxis recharts component rendered on the right side

rightYAxisLabel.description: Props passed down to the YAxis recharts component rendered on the right side

persistence.description:
Used to allow user interactions in this component to be persisted when
the component - or the page - is refreshed. If `persisted` is truthy and
hasn't changed from its previous value, a `value` that the user has
changed while using the app will keep that change, as long as
the new `value` also matches what was given originally.
Used in conjunction with `persistence_type`.

persisted_props.description:
Properties whose user interactions will persist after refreshing the
component or the page. Since only `value` is allowed this prop can
normally be ignored.

persistence_type.description:
Where persisted user changes will be stored:
memory: only kept in memory, reset on page refresh.
local: window.localStorage, data is kept after the browser quit.
session: window.sessionStorage, data is cleared once the browser quit.

persistence.description:
Used to allow user interactions in this component to be persisted when
the component - or the page - is refreshed. If `persisted` is truthy and
hasn't changed from its previous value, a `value` that the user has
changed while using the app will keep that change, as long as
the new `value` also matches what was given originally.
Used in conjunction with `persistence_type`.

persisted_props.description:
Properties whose user interactions will persist after refreshing the
component or the page. Since only `value` is allowed this prop can
normally be ignored.

persistence_type.description:
Where persisted user changes will be stored:
memory: only kept in memory, reset on page refresh.
local: window.localStorage, data is kept after the browser quit.
session: window.sessionStorage, data is cleared once the browser quit.

memory: only kept in memory, reset on page refresh.
local: window.localStorage, data is kept after the browser quit.
session: window.sessionStorage, data is cleared once the browser quit.

id.description: Unique ID to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

loading_state.description: Object that holds the loading state object coming from dash-renderer

type.name: shape

is_loading.description: Determines if the component is loading or not
is_loading.name: bool

component_name.description: Holds the name of the component that is loading
component_name.name: string

type.raw: { is_loading: boolean; prop_name: string; component_name: string; }

fullWidth.description: Determines whether the component should take 100% width of its container, `false` by default

focusable.description: Determines whether interactive elements (sliders thumbs and swatches) should be focusable, `true` by default

className.description: Class added to the root element, if applicable

style.description: Inline style added to root component element, can subscribe to theme defined on MantineProvider

hiddenFrom.description: Breakpoint above which the component is hidden with `display: none`

visibleFrom.description: Breakpoint below which the component is hidden with `display: none`

lightHidden.description: Determines whether component should be hidden in light color scheme with `display: none`

darkHidden.description: Determines whether component should be hidden in dark color scheme with `display: none`

mod.description: Element modifiers transformed into `data-` attributes, for example, `{ 'data-size': 'xl' }`, falsy values are removed

withPicker.description: Determines whether the color picker should be displayed, `true` by default

swatches.description: An array of colors in one of the supported formats. Used to render swatches list below the color picker.

swatchesPerRow.description: Number of swatches per row, `7` by default

size.description: Controls size of hue, alpha and saturation sliders, `'md'` by default

classNames.description: Adds class names to Mantine components

unstyled.description: Remove all Mantine styling from the component

persistence.description:
Used to allow user interactions in this component to be persisted when
the component - or the page - is refreshed. If `persisted` is truthy and
hasn't changed from its previous value, a `value` that the user has
changed while using the app will keep that change, as long as
the new `value` also matches what was given originally.
Used in conjunction with `persistence_type`.

persisted_props.description:
Properties whose user interactions will persist after refreshing the
component or the page. Since only `value` is allowed this prop can
normally be ignored.

persistence_type.description:
Where persisted user changes will be stored:
memory: only kept in memory, reset on page refresh.
local: window.localStorage, data is kept after the browser quit.
session: window.sessionStorage, data is cleared once the browser quit.

scrollbarSize.name: union

type.description:
Defines scrollbars behavior, `hover` by default
- `hover` – scrollbars are visible when mouse is over the scroll area
- `scroll` – scrollbars are visible when the scroll area is scrolled
- `always` – scrollbars are always visible
- `never` – scrollbars are always hidden
- `auto` – similar to `overflow: auto` – scrollbars are always visible when the content is overflowing
type.name: enum

scrollHideDelay.description: Scroll hide delay in ms, applicable only when type is set to `hover` or `scroll`, `1000` by default
scrollHideDelay.name: number

scrollbars.description: Axis at which scrollbars must be rendered, `'xy'` by default
scrollbars.name: any

offsetScrollbars.description: Determines whether scrollbars should be offset with padding on given axis, `false` by default
offsetScrollbars.name: any

label.description: Contents of `Input.Label` component. If not set, label is not rendered.

description.description: Contents of `Input.Description` component. If not set, description is not rendered.

error.description: Contents of `Input.Error` component. If not set, error is not rendered.

required.description: Adds required attribute to the input and a red asterisk on the right side of label, `false` by default

withAsterisk.description: Determines whether the required asterisk should be displayed. Overrides `required` prop. Does not add required attribute to the input. `false` by default

descriptionProps.description: Props passed down to the `Input.Description` component

errorProps.description: Props passed down to the `Input.Error` component

leftSection.description: Content section rendered on the left side of the input

leftSectionWidth.description: Left section width, used to set `width` of the section and input `padding-left`, by default equals to the input height

leftSectionProps.description: Props passed down to the `leftSection` element

leftSectionPointerEvents.description: Sets `pointer-events` styles on the `leftSection` element, `'none'` by default

rightSection.description: Content section rendered on the right side of the input

rightSectionWidth.description: Right section width, used to set `width` of the section and input `padding-right`, by default equals to the input height

rightSectionProps.description: Props passed down to the `rightSection` element

rightSectionPointerEvents.description: Sets `pointer-events` styles on the `rightSection` element, `'none'` by default

radius.description: Key of `theme.radius` or any valid CSS value to set `border-radius`, numbers are converted to rem, `theme.defaultRadius` by default

disabled.description: Sets `disabled` attribute on the `input` element

size.description: Controls input `height` and horizontal `padding`, `'sm'` by default

pointer.description: Determines whether the input should have `cursor: pointer` style, `false` by default

withErrorStyles.description: Determines whether the input should have red border and red text color when the `error` prop is set, `true` by default

selectFirstOptionOnChange.description: Determines whether the first option should be selected when value changes, `false` by default

id.description: Unique ID to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

loading_state.description: Object that holds the loading state object coming from dash-renderer

type.name: shape

is_loading.description: Determines if the component is loading or not
is_loading.name: bool

component_name.description: Holds the name of the component that is loading
component_name.name: string

type.raw: { is_loading: boolean; prop_name: string; component_name: string; }

n_blur.description: An integer that represents the number of times that this element has lost focus

n_submit.description: An integer that represents the number of times that this element has been submitted

debounce.description: (boolean | number; default False): If True, changes to input will be sent back to the Dash server only on enter or when losing focus. If it's False, it will send the value back on every change. If a number, it will not send anything back to the Dash server until the user has stopped typing for that number of milliseconds.

persistence.description:
Used to allow user interactions in this component to be persisted when
the component - or the page - is refreshed. If `persisted` is truthy and
hasn't changed from its previous value, a `value` that the user has
changed while using the app will keep that change, as long as
the new `value` also matches what was given originally.
Used in conjunction with `persistence_type`.

persisted_props.description:
Properties whose user interactions will persist after refreshing the
component or the page. Since only `value` is allowed this prop can
normally be ignored.

persistence_type.description:
Where persisted user changes will be stored:
memory: only kept in memory, reset on page refresh.
local: window.localStorage, data is kept after the browser quit.
session: window.sessionStorage, data is cleared once the browser quit.

searchable.description: Determines whether the select should be searchable, `false` by default

withCheckIcon.description: Determines whether check icon should be displayed near the selected option label, `true` by default

checkIconPosition.description: Position of the check icon relative to the option label, `'left'` by default

nothingFoundMessage.description: Message displayed when no option matched current search query, only applicable when `searchable` prop is set

allowDeselect.description: Determines whether it should be possible to deselect value by clicking on the selected option, `true` by default

clearable.description: Determines whether the clear button should be displayed in the right section when the component has value, `false` by default

clearButtonProps.description: Props passed down to the clear button

size.description: Controls width and height of the button. Numbers are converted to rem. `'md'` by default.
size.name: union

radius.description: Key of `theme.radius` or any valid CSS value to set border-radius. Numbers are converted to rem. `theme.defaultRadius` by default.
radius.name: union

disabled.description: Sets `disabled` and `data-disabled` attributes on the button element
disabled.name: bool

children.description: Content rendered inside the button, for example `VisuallyHidden` with label for screen readers
children.name: node

icon.description: Replaces default close icon. If set, `iconSize` prop is ignored.
icon.name: node

hiddenInputProps.description: Props passed down to the hidden input

scrollAreaProps.description: Props passed down to the underlying `ScrollArea` component in the dropdown

scrollbarSize.description: Scrollbar size, any valid CSS value for width/height, numbers are converted to rem, default value is 0.75rem
scrollbarSize.name: union

type.description:
Defines scrollbars behavior, `hover` by default
- `hover` – scrollbars are visible when mouse is over the scroll area
- `scroll` – scrollbars are visible when the scroll area is scrolled
- `always` – scrollbars are always visible
- `never` – scrollbars are always hidden
- `auto` – similar to `overflow: auto` – scrollbars are always visible when the content is overflowing
type.name: enum

scrollHideDelay.description: Scroll hide delay in ms, applicable only when type is set to `hover` or `scroll`, `1000` by default
scrollHideDelay.name: number

scrollbars.description: Axis at which scrollbars must be rendered, `'xy'` by default
scrollbars.name: any

offsetScrollbars.description: Determines whether scrollbars should be offset with padding on given axis, `false` by default
offsetScrollbars.name: any

className.description: Class added to the root element, if applicable
className.name: string

style.description: Inline style added to root component element, can subscribe to theme defined on MantineProvider
style.name: union

hiddenFrom.description: Breakpoint above which the component is hidden with `display: none`
hiddenFrom.name: any

visibleFrom.description: Breakpoint below which the component is hidden with `display: none`
visibleFrom.name: any

lightHidden.description: Determines whether component should be hidden in light color scheme with `display: none`
lightHidden.name: bool

darkHidden.description: Determines whether component should be hidden in dark color scheme with `display: none`
darkHidden.name: bool

mod.description: Element modifiers transformed into `data-` attributes, for example, `{ 'data-size': 'xl' }`, falsy values are removed
mod.name: union

required.description: Adds required attribute to the input and a red asterisk on the right side of label, `false` by default

withAsterisk.description: Determines whether the required asterisk should be displayed. Overrides `required` prop. Does not add required attribute to the input. `false` by default

descriptionProps.description: Props passed down to the `Input.Description` component

errorProps.description: Props passed down to the `Input.Error` component

inputWrapperOrder.description: Controls order of the elements, `['label', 'description', 'input', 'error']` by default

leftSection.description: Content section rendered on the left side of the input

leftSectionWidth.description: Left section width, used to set `width` of the section and input `padding-left`, by default equals to the input height

leftSectionProps.description: Props passed down to the `leftSection` element

leftSectionPointerEvents.description: Sets `pointer-events` styles on the `leftSection` element, `'none'` by default

rightSection.description: Content section rendered on the right side of the input

rightSectionWidth.description: Right section width, used to set `width` of the section and input `padding-right`, by default equals to the input height

rightSectionProps.description: Props passed down to the `rightSection` element

rightSectionPointerEvents.description: Sets `pointer-events` styles on the `rightSection` element, `'none'` by default

radius.description: Key of `theme.radius` or any valid CSS value to set `border-radius`, numbers are converted to rem, `theme.defaultRadius` by default

disabled.description: Sets `disabled` attribute on the `input` element

size.description: Controls input `height` and horizontal `padding`, `'sm'` by default

pointer.description: Determines whether the input should have `cursor: pointer` style, `false` by default

withErrorStyles.description: Determines whether the input should have red border and red text color when the `error` prop is set, `true` by default

selectFirstOptionOnChange.description: Determines whether the first option should be selected when value changes, `false` by default

size.description: Controls items `font-size` and `padding`, `'sm'` by default
size.name: any

dropdownPadding.description: Controls `padding` of the dropdown, `4` by default

resetSelectionOnOptionHover.description: Determines whether selection should be reset when option is hovered, `false` by default
resetSelectionOnOptionHover.name: bool

position.name: enum

offset.name: union

positionDependencies.name: arrayOf

persistence.description:
Used to allow user interactions in this component to be persisted when
the component - or the page - is refreshed. If `persisted` is truthy and
hasn't changed from its previous value, a `value` that the user has
changed while using the app will keep that change, as long as
the new `value` also matches what was given originally.
Used in conjunction with `persistence_type`.

persisted_props.description:
Properties whose user interactions will persist after refreshing the
component or the page. Since only `value` is allowed this prop can
normally be ignored.

persistence_type.description:
Where persisted user changes will be stored:
memory: only kept in memory, reset on page refresh.
local: window.localStorage, data is kept after the browser quit.
session: window.sessionStorage, data is cleared once the browser quit.

mainAxis.description:
The axis that runs along the side of the floating element. Determines
whether overflow along this axis is checked to perform a flip.
@,default,true
mainAxis.name: bool

crossAxis.description:
The axis that runs along the alignment of the floating element. Determines
whether overflow along this axis is checked to perform a flip.
@,default,true
crossAxis.name: bool

rootBoundary.description:
The root clipping area in which overflow will be checked.
@,default,'viewport'

@,default,false

Virtual padding for the resolved overflow detection offsets.
@,default,0

Placements to try sequentially if the preferred `placement` does not fit.
@,default,[oppositePlacement] (computed)

fallbackStrategy.description:
What strategy to use when no placements fit.
@,default,'bestFit'
fallbackStrategy.name: enum

fallbackAxisSideDirection.description:
Whether to allow fallback to the perpendicular axis of the preferred
placement, and if so, which side direction along the axis to prefer.
@,default,'none' (disallow fallback)
fallbackAxisSideDirection.name: enum

flipAlignment.description:
Whether to flip to placements with the opposite alignment if they fit
better.
@,default,true
flipAlignment.name: bool

n_blur.description: An integer that represents the number of times that this element has lost focus

n_submit.description: An integer that represents the number of times that this element has been submitted

debounce.description: (boolean | number; default False): If True, changes to input will be sent back to the Dash server only on enter or when losing focus. If it's False, it will send the value back on every change. If a number, it will not send anything back to the Dash server until the user has stopped typing for that number of milliseconds.

persistence.description:
Used to allow user interactions in this component to be persisted when
the component - or the page - is refreshed. If `persisted` is truthy and
hasn't changed from its previous value, a `value` that the user has
changed while using the app will keep that change, as long as
the new `value` also matches what was given originally.
Used in conjunction with `persistence_type`.

persisted_props.description:

component or the page. Since only `value` is allowed this prop can
normally be ignored.

persistence_type.description:
Where persisted user changes will be stored:
memory: only kept in memory, reset on page refresh.
local: window.localStorage, data is kept after the browser quit.
session: window.sessionStorage, data is cleared once the browser quit.

allowLeadingZeros.description: Determines whether leading zeros are allowed. If not set, leading zeros are removed when the input is blurred. `false` by default

allowNegative.description: Determines whether negative values are allowed, `true` by default

allowedDecimalSeparators.description: Characters which when pressed result in a decimal separator, `['.']` by default

decimalScale.description: Limits the number of digits that can be entered after the decimal point

decimalSeparator.description: Character used as a decimal separator, `'.'` by default

fixedDecimalScale.description: If set, 0s are added after `decimalSeparator` to match given `decimalScale`. `false` by default

prefix.description: Prefix added before the input value

suffix.description: Suffix added after the input value

valueIsNumericString.description: If value is passed as string representation of numbers (unformatted) and number is used in any format props like in prefix or suffix in numeric format and format prop in pattern format then this should be passed as `true`. `false` by default.

thousandSeparator.description: A character used to separate thousands

step.description: Number by which value will be incremented/decremented with up/down controls and keyboard arrows, `1` by default

hideControls.description: Determines whether the up/down controls should be hidden, `false` by default

clampBehavior.description: Controls how value is clamped, `strict` – user is not allowed to enter values that are not in `[min, max]` range, `blur` – user is allowed to enter any values, but the value is clamped when the input loses focus (default behavior), `none` – lifts all restrictions, `[min, max]` range is applied only for controls and up/down keys

allowDecimal.description: Determines whether decimal values are allowed, `true` by default

startValue.description: Value set to the input when increment/decrement buttons are clicked or up/down arrows pressed if the input is empty, `0` by default

stepHoldInterval.description: Delay before stepping the value. Can be a number of milliseconds or a function that receives the current step count and returns the delay in milliseconds.

stepHoldDelay.description: Initial delay in milliseconds before stepping the value.

autoComplete.description: (string; default "off") Enables the browser to attempt autocompletion based on user history.  For more information, see: https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTML/Attributes/autocomplete

debounce.description: (boolean | number; default False): If True, changes to input will be sent back to the Dash server only on enter or when losing focus. If it's False, it will send the value back on every change. If a number, it will not send anything back to the Dash server until the user has stopped typing for that number of milliseconds.

persistence.description:
Used to allow user interactions in this component to be persisted when
the component - or the page - is refreshed. If `persisted` is truthy and
hasn't changed from its previous value, a `value` that the user has
changed while using the app will keep that change, as long as
the new `value` also matches what was given originally.
Used in conjunction with `persistence_type`.

persisted_props.description:
Properties whose user interactions will persist after refreshing the
component or the page. Since only `value` is allowed this prop can
normally be ignored.

persistence_type.description:
Where persisted user changes will be stored:
memory: only kept in memory, reset on page refresh.
local: window.localStorage, data is kept after the browser quit.
session: window.sessionStorage, data is cleared once the browser quit.

oneTimeCode.description: Determines whether `autocomplete="one-time-code"` attribute should be set on all inputs, `true` by default

trapFocus.description: Determines whether dropdown should trap focus of keyboard events

closeDelay.description: Close delay in ms, applicable only to trigger="hover" variant

position.description: Dropdown position relative to the target element, `'bottom'` by default

offset.description: Offset of the dropdown element, `8` by default

positionDependencies.description: `useEffect` dependencies to force update dropdown position, `[]` by default

keepMounted.description: If set dropdown will not be unmounted from the DOM when it is hidden, `display: none` styles will be added instead

mounted.name: bool

value.name: shape

mainAxis.description:
The axis that runs along the side of the floating element. Determines
whether overflow along this axis is checked to perform a flip.
@,default,true
mainAxis.name: bool

crossAxis.description:
The axis that runs along the alignment of the floating element. Determines
whether overflow along this axis is checked to perform a flip.
@,default,true
crossAxis.name: bool

rootBoundary.description:
The root clipping area in which overflow will be checked.
@,default,'viewport'
rootBoundary.name: any

elementContext.description:
The element in which overflow is being checked relative to a boundary.
@,default,'floating'
elementContext.name: enum

altBoundary.description:
Whether to check for overflow using the alternate element's boundary
(`clippingAncestors` boundary only).
@,default,false
altBoundary.name: bool

padding.description:
Virtual padding for the resolved overflow detection offsets.
@,default,0
padding.name: union

fallbackPlacements.description:
Placements to try sequentially if the preferred `placement` does not fit.
@,default,[oppositePlacement] (computed)
fallbackPlacements.name: arrayOf

fallbackStrategy.description:
What strategy to use when no placements fit.
@,default,'bestFit'
fallbackStrategy.name: enum

fallbackAxisSideDirection.description:
Whether to allow fallback to the perpendicular axis of the preferred
placement, and if so, which side direction along the axis to prefer.
@,default,'none' (disallow fallback)
fallbackAxisSideDirection.name: enum

flipAlignment.description:
Whether to flip to placements with the opposite alignment if they fit
better.
@,default,true
flipAlignment.name: bool

persistence.description:
Used to allow user interactions in this component to be persisted when
the component - or the page - is refreshed. If `persisted` is truthy and
hasn't changed from its previous value, a `value` that the user has
changed while using the app will keep that change, as long as
the new `value` also matches what was given originally.
Used in conjunction with `persistence_type`.

persisted_props.description:
Properties whose user interactions will persist after refreshing the
component or the page. Since only `value` is allowed this prop can
normally be ignored.

persistence_type.description:
Where persisted user changes will be stored:
memory: only kept in memory, reset on page refresh.
local: window.localStorage, data is kept after the browser quit.
session: window.sessionStorage, data is cleared once the browser quit.

wrapperProps.description: Props passed down to the `Input.Wrapper`

size.description: Controls size of the `Input.Wrapper`, `'sm'` by default

name.description: `name` attribute of child radio inputs. By default, `name` is generated randomly.

readOnly.description: If set, value cannot be changed

deselectable.description: Allow to deselect Chip in Radio mode

label.description: Contents of `Input.Label` component. If not set, label is not rendered.

description.description: Contents of `Input.Description` component. If not set, description is not rendered.

error.description: Contents of `Input.Error` component. If not set, error is not rendered.

required.description: Adds required attribute to the input and a red asterisk on the right side of label, `false` by default

withAsterisk.description: Determines whether the required asterisk should be displayed. Overrides `required` prop. Does not add required attribute to the input. `false` by default

labelProps.description: Props passed down to the `Input.Label` component

descriptionProps.description: Props passed down to the `Input.Description` component

errorProps.description: Props passed down to the `Input.Error` component

inputWrapperOrder.description: Controls order of the elements, `['label', 'description', 'input', 'error']` by default

iconSize.description: Controls size of the step icon, by default icon size is inferred from `size` prop

contentPadding.description: Key of `theme.spacing` or any valid CSS value to set `padding-top` of the content

radius.description: Key of `theme.radius` or any valid CSS value to set steps border-radius, `"xl"` by default

allowNextStepsSelect.description: Determines whether next steps can be selected, `true` by default *

wrap.description: Determines whether steps should wrap to the next line if no space is available, `true` by default

autoContrast.description: Determines whether icon color with filled variant should depend on `background-color`. If luminosity of the `color` prop is less than `theme.luminosityThreshold`, then `theme.white` will be used for text color, otherwise `theme.black`. Overrides `theme.autoContrast`.

If luminosity of the `color` prop is less than `theme.luminosityThreshold`, then `theme.white` will be used for text color, otherwise `theme.black`. Overrides `theme.autoContrast`. persistence.description:
Used to allow user interactions in this component to be persisted when
the component - or the page - is refreshed. If `persisted` is truthy and
hasn't changed from its previous value, a `value` that the user has
changed while using the app will keep that change, as long as
the new `value` also matches what was given originally.
Used in conjunction with `persistence_type`.

persisted_props.description:
Properties whose user interactions will persist after refreshing the
component or the page. Since only `value` is allowed this prop can
normally be ignored.

persistence_type.description:
Where persisted user changes will be stored:
memory: only kept in memory, reset on page refresh.
local: window.localStorage, data is kept after the browser quit.
session: window.sessionStorage, data is cleared once the browser quit.

persistence.description:
Used to allow user interactions in this component to be persisted when
the component - or the page - is refreshed. If `persisted` is truthy and
hasn't changed from its previous value, a `value` that the user has
changed while using the app will keep that change, as long as
the new `value` also matches what was given originally.
Used in conjunction with `persistence_type`.

persisted_props.description:
Properties whose user interactions will persist after refreshing the
component or the page. Since only `value` is allowed this prop can
normally be ignored.

persistence_type.description:
Where persisted user changes will be stored:
memory: only kept in memory, reset on page refresh.
local: window.localStorage, data is kept after the browser quit.
session: window.sessionStorage, data is cleared once the browser quit.

persistence.description:
Used to allow user interactions in this component to be persisted when
the component - or the page - is refreshed. If `persisted` is truthy and
hasn't changed from its previous value, a `value` that the user has
changed while using the app will keep that change, as long as
the new `value` also matches what was given originally.
Used in conjunction with `persistence_type`.

persisted_props.description:
Properties whose user interactions will persist after refreshing the
component or the page. Since only `value` is allowed this prop can

Defines scrollbars behavior, `hover` by default
- `hover` – scrollbars are visible when mouse is over the scroll area
- `scroll` – scrollbars are visible when the scroll area is scrolled
- `always` – scrollbars are always visible
- `never` – scrollbars are always hidden
- `auto` – similar to `overflow: auto` – scrollbars are always visible when the content is overflowing

persistence.description:
Used to allow user interactions in this component to be persisted when
the component - or the page - is refreshed. If `persisted` is truthy and
hasn't changed from its previous value, a `value` that the user has
changed while using the app will keep that change, as long as
the new `value` also matches what was given originally.
Used in conjunction with `persistence_type`.

persisted_props.description:
Properties whose user interactions will persist after refreshing the
component or the page. Since only `value` is allowed this prop can
normally be ignored.

persistence_type.description:
Where persisted user changes will be stored:
memory: only kept in memory, reset on page refresh.
local: window.localStorage, data is kept after the browser quit.
session: window.sessionStorage, data is cleared once the browser quit.

n_blur.description: An integer that represents the number of times that this element has lost focus

n_submit.description: An integer that represents the number of times that this element has been submitted

debounce.description: (boolean | number; default False): If True, changes to input will be sent back to the Dash server only on enter or when losing focus. If it's False, it will send the value back on every change. If a number, it will not send anything back to the Dash server until the user has stopped typing for that number of milliseconds.

style.description: Inline style added to root component element, can subscribe to theme defined on MantineProvider

hiddenFrom.description: Breakpoint above which the component is hidden with `display: none`

wrapperProps.description: Props passed down to the root element

leftSection.description: Content section rendered on the left side of the input

leftSectionWidth.description: Left section width, used to set `width` of the section and input `padding-left`, by default equals to the input height

leftSectionProps.description: Props passed down to the `leftSection` element

leftSectionPointerEvents.description: Sets `pointer-events` styles on the `leftSection` element, `'none'` by default

rightSection.description: Content section rendered on the right side of the input

rightSectionWidth.description: Right section width, used to set `width` of the section and input `padding-right`, by default equals to the input height

rightSectionProps.description: Props passed down to the `rightSection` element

rightSectionPointerEvents.description: Sets `pointer-events` styles on the `rightSection` element, `'none'` by default

required.description: Adds required attribute to the input and a red asterisk on the right side of label, `false` by default

radius.description: Key of `theme.radius` or any valid CSS value to set `border-radius`, numbers are converted to rem, `theme.defaultRadius` by default

disabled.description: Sets `disabled` attribute on the `input` element

pointer.description: Determines whether the input should have `cursor: pointer` style, `false` by default

withErrorStyles.description: Determines whether the input should have red border and red text color when the `error` prop is set, `true` by default

readOnly.description: Readonly

label.description: Contents of `Input.Label` component. If not set, label is not rendered.

description.description: Contents of `Input.Description` component. If not set, description is not rendered.

error.description: Contents of `Input.Error` component. If not set, error is not rendered.

withAsterisk.description: Determines whether the required asterisk should be displayed. Overrides `required` prop. Does not add required attribute to the input. `false` by default

labelProps.description: Props passed down to the `Input.Label` component

descriptionProps.description: Props passed down to the `Input.Description` component

errorProps.description: Props passed down to the `Input.Error` component

inputWrapperOrder.description: Controls order of the elements, `['label', 'description', 'input', 'error']` by default

numberOfColumns.description: Number of columns to render next to each other

columnsToScroll.description: Number of columns to scroll when user clicks next/prev buttons, defaults to numberOfColumns

ariaLabels.description: aria-label attributes for controls on different levels

decadeLabelFormat.description: dayjs label format to display decade label or a function that returns decade label based on date value, defaults to "YYYY"

yearsListFormat.description: dayjs format for years list, `'YYYY'` by default

size.description: Component size

withCellSpacing.description: Determines whether controls should be separated by spacing, true by default

nextDisabled.description: Determines whether next control should be disabled, defaults to true

previousDisabled.description: Determines whether previous control should be disabled, defaults to true

withNext.description: Determines whether next control should be rendered, defaults to true

withPrevious.description: Determines whether previous control should be rendered, defaults to true

yearLabelFormat.description: dayjs label format to display year label or a function that returns year label based on year value, defaults to "YYYY"

hasNextLevel.description: Determines whether next level button should be enabled, defaults to true

monthLabelFormat.description: dayjs label format to display month label or a function that returns month label based on month value, defaults to "MMMM YYYY"

firstDayOfWeek.description: number 0-6, 0 – Sunday, 6 – Saturday, defaults to 1 – Monday

weekdayFormat.description: dayjs format for weekdays names, defaults to "dd"

weekendDays.description: Indices of weekend days, 0-6, where 0 is Sunday and 6 is Saturday, defaults to value defined in DatesProvider

hideOutsideDates.description: Determines whether outside dates should be hidden, defaults to false

hideWeekdays.description: Determines whether weekdays row should be hidden, defaults to false

persistence.description:
Used to allow user interactions in this component to be persisted when
the component - or the page - is refreshed. If `persisted` is truthy and
hasn't changed from its previous value, a `value` that the user has
changed while using the app will keep that change, as long as
the new `value` also matches what was given originally.
Used in conjunction with `persistence_type`.

persisted_props.description:
Properties whose user interactions will persist after refreshing the
component or the page. Since only `value` is allowed this prop can
normally be ignored.

persistence_type.description:
Where persisted user changes will be stored:
memory: only kept in memory, reset on page refresh.
local: window.localStorage, data is kept after the browser quit.
session: window.sessionStorage, data is cleared once the browser quit.

persistence.description:
Used to allow user interactions in this component to be persisted when
the component - or the page - is refreshed. If `persisted` is truthy and
hasn't changed from its previous value, a `value` that the user has
changed while using the app will keep that change, as long as
the new `value` also matches what was given originally.
Used in conjunction with `persistence_type`.

persisted_props.description:
Properties whose user interactions will persist after refreshing the
component or the page. Since only `value` is allowed this prop can
normally be ignored.

persistence_type.description:
Where persisted user changes will be stored:
memory: only kept in memory, reset on page refresh.
local: window.localStorage, data is kept after the browser quit.
session: window.sessionStorage, data is cleared once the browser quit.

persistence_type.description:
Where persisted user changes will be stored:
memory: only kept in memory, reset on page refresh.
local: window.localStorage, data is kept after the browser quit.
session: window.sessionStorage, data is cleared once the browser quit.

yearsListFormat.description: dayjs format for years list, `'YYYY'` by default

columnsToScroll.description: Number of columns to scroll when user clicks next/prev buttons, defaults to numberOfColumns

ariaLabels.description: aria-label attributes for controls on different levels

level.description: Current level displayed to the user (decade, year, month), used for controlled component

hasNextLevel.description: Determines whether next level button should be enabled, defaults to true

yearLabelFormat.description: dayjs label format to display year label or a function that returns year label based on year value, defaults to "YYYY"

monthLabelFormat.description: dayjs label format to display month label or a function that returns month label based on month value, defaults to "MMMM YYYY"

firstDayOfWeek.description: number 0-6, 0 – Sunday, 6 – Saturday, defaults to 1 – Monday

weekdayFormat.description: dayjs format for weekdays names, defaults to "dd"

weekendDays.description: Indices of weekend days, 0-6, where 0 is Sunday and 6 is Saturday, defaults to value defined in DatesProvider

hideOutsideDates.description: Determines whether outside dates should be hidden, defaults to false

hideWeekdays.description: Determines whether weekdays row should be hidden, defaults to false

classNames.description: Adds class names to Mantine components

unstyled.description: Remove all Mantine styling from the component

active.description: The index of the current slide. Read only.  Use initialSlide to set the current slide

controlSize.description: Controls size of the next and previous controls, `26` by default

controlsOffset.description: Controls position of the next and previous controls, key of `theme.spacing` or any valid CSS value, `'sm'` by default

slideSize.description: Controls slide width based on viewport width, `'100%'` by default

slideGap.description: Key of theme.spacing or number to set gap between slides

height.description: Slides container `height`, required for vertical orientation

align.description: Determines how slides will be aligned relative to the container. Use number between 0-1 to align slides based on percentage, where 0.5 is 50%, `'center'` by default

slidesToScroll.description: Number of slides that will be scrolled with next/previous buttons, `1` by default

includeGapInSize.description: Determines whether gap between slides should be treated as part of the slide size, `true` by default

draggable.description: Determines whether the carousel can be scrolled with mouse and touch interactions, `true` by default

dragFree.description: Determines whether momentum scrolling should be enabled, `false` by default

loop.description: Enables infinite looping. `true` by default, automatically falls back to `false` if slide content isn't enough to loop.

speed.description: Adjusts scroll speed when triggered by any of the methods. Higher numbers enables faster scrolling.

inViewThreshold.description: Choose a fraction representing the percentage portion of a slide that needs to be visible in order to be considered in view. For example, 0.5 equals 50%.

withControls.description: Determines whether next/previous controls should be displayed, true by default

withIndicators.description: Determines whether indicators should be displayed, `false` by default

skipSnaps.description: Allow the carousel to skip scroll snaps if it is dragged vigorously. Note that this option will be ignored if the dragFree option is set to `true`, `false` by default

containScroll.description: Clear leading and trailing empty space that causes excessive scrolling. Use `trimSnaps` to only use snap points that trigger scrolling or keepSnaps to keep them.

withKeyboardEvents.description: Determines whether arrow key should switch slides, `true` by default

style.description: Inline style added to root component element, can subscribe to theme defined on MantineProvider

hiddenFrom.description: Breakpoint above which the component is hidden with `display: none`

visibleFrom.description: Breakpoint below which the component is hidden with `display: none`

lightHidden.description: Determines whether component should be hidden in light color scheme with `display: none`

darkHidden.description: Determines whether component should be hidden in dark color scheme with `display: none`

mod.description: Element modifiers transformed into `data-` attributes, for example, `{ 'data-size': 'xl' }`, falsy values are removed

classNames.description: Adds class names to Mantine components

unstyled.description: Remove all Mantine styling from the component

id.description: Unique ID to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

loading_state.description: Object that holds the loading state object coming from dash-renderer

type.name: shape

is_loading.description: Determines if the component is loading or not
is_loading.name: bool

component_name.description: Holds the name of the component that is loading
component_name.name: string

type.raw: { is_loading: boolean; prop_name: string; component_name: string; }

value.description: value to set the progress bar to

color.description: Key of `theme.colors` of any other valid CSS color, `theme.primaryColor` by default

size.description: Controls height of the progress bar

stepInterval.description: Step interval in ms, `500` by default

withinPortal.description: Determines whether the progress bar should be rendered within `Portal`, `true` by default

id.description: Unique ID to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

loading_state.description: Object that holds the loading state object coming from dash-renderer

type.name: shape

is_loading.description: Determines if the component is loading or not
is_loading.name: bool

component_name.description: Holds the name of the component that is loading
component_name.name: string

type.raw: { is_loading: boolean; prop_name: string; component_name: string; }

id.description: Unique ID to identify this component in Dash callbacks.

focusRing.description:
Controls focus ring styles. Supports the following options:
- `auto` – focus ring is displayed only when the user navigates with keyboard (default value)
- `always` – focus ring is displayed when the user navigates with keyboard and mouse
- `never` – focus ring is always hidden (not recommended)
focusRing.name: enum

scale.description:
Rem units scale, change if you customize font-size of `<html />` element
default value is `1` (for `100%`/`16px` font-size on `<html />`)
scale.name: number

fontSmoothing.description: Determines whether `font-smoothing` property should be set on the body, `true` by default
fontSmoothing.name: bool

colors.description: Object of colors, key is color name, value is an array of at least 10 strings (colors)
colors.name: shape

primaryShade.description:
Index of theme.colors[color].
Primary shade is used in all components to determine which color from theme.colors[color] should be used.
Can be either a number (0–9) or an object to specify different color shades for light and dark color schemes.
Default value `{ light: 6, dark: 8 }`

For example,
{ primaryShade: 6 } // shade 6 is used both for dark and light color schemes
{ primaryShade: { light: 6, dark: 7 } } // different shades for dark and light color schemes
primaryShade.name: any

primaryColor.description:
Key of `theme.colors`, hex/rgb/hsl values are not supported.
Determines which color will be used in all components by default.
Default value – `blue`.
primaryColor.name: string

variantColorResolver.description:
Function to resolve colors based on variant.
Can be used to deeply customize how colors are applied to `Button`, `ActionIcon`, `ThemeIcon`
and other components that use colors from theme.
variantColorResolver.name: shape

autoContrast.description:
Determines whether text color must be changed based on the given `color` prop in filled variant
For example, if you pass `color="blue.1"` to Button component, text color will be changed to `var(--mantine-color-black)`
Default value – `false`
autoContrast.name: bool

luminanceThreshold.description:
Determines which luminance value is used to determine if text color should be light or dark.
Used only if `theme.autoContrast` is set to `true`.
Default value is `0.3`
luminanceThreshold.name: number

fontFamily.description: Font-family used in all components, system fonts by default
fontFamily.name: string

fontFamilyMonospace.description: Monospace font-family, used in code and other similar components, system fonts by default
fontFamilyMonospace.name: string

headings.description: Controls various styles of h1-h6 elements, used in TypographyStylesProvider and Title components
headings.name: shape

sizes.name: shape
sizes.raw: PartialObjectDeep<{ h1: HeadingStyle; h2: HeadingStyle; h3: HeadingStyle; h4: HeadingStyle; h5: HeadingStyle; h6: HeadingStyle; }, {}>

headings.raw: PartialObjectDeep<{ fontFamily: string; fontWeight: string; textWrap: "wrap" | "nowrap" | "balance" | "pretty" | "stable"; sizes: { h1: HeadingStyle; h2: HeadingStyle; h3: HeadingStyle; h4: HeadingStyle; h5: HeadingStyle; h6: HeadingStyle; }; }, {}>

radius.description: Object of values that are used to set `border-radius` in all components that support it
radius.name: shape

defaultRadius.description: Key of `theme.radius` or any valid CSS value. Default `border-radius` used by most components
defaultRadius.name: union

spacing.description: Object of values that are used to set various CSS properties that control spacing between elements
spacing.name: shape

fontSizes.description: Object of values that are used to control `font-size` property in all components
fontSizes.name: shape

lineHeights.description: Object of values that are used to control `line-height` property in `Text` component
lineHeights.name: shape

breakpoints.description:
Object of values that are used to control breakpoints in all components,
values are expected to be defined in em
breakpoints.name: shape

shadows.description: Object of values that are used to add `box-shadow` styles to components that support `shadow` prop
shadows.name: shape

respectReducedMotion.description: Determines whether user OS settings to reduce motion should be respected, `false` by default
respectReducedMotion.name: bool

cursorType.description:
Determines which cursor type will be used for interactive elements
- `default` – cursor that is used by native HTML elements, for example, `input[type="checkbox"]` has `cursor: default` styles
- `pointer` – sets `cursor: pointer` on interactive elements that do not have these styles by default
cursorType.name: enum

defaultGradient.description: Default gradient configuration for components that support `variant="gradient"`
defaultGradient.name: shape

activeClassName.description: Class added to the elements that have active styles, for example, `Button` and `ActionIcon`
activeClassName.name: string

focusClassName.description:
Class added to the elements that have focus styles, for example, `Button` or `ActionIcon`.
Overrides `theme.focusRing` property.
focusClassName.name: string

components.description: Allows adding `classNames`, `styles` and `defaultProps` to any component
components.name: shape

other.description: Any other properties that you want to access with the theme objects
other.name: shape

colorSchemeManager.description: Used to retrieve/set color scheme value in external storage, by default uses `window.localStorage`

get.description: Function to retrieve color scheme value from external storage, for example window.localStorage
get.name: func

set.description: Function to set color scheme value in external storage, for example window.localStorage
set.name: func

subscribe.description: Function to subscribe to color scheme changes triggered by external events
subscribe.name: func

unsubscribe.description: Function to unsubscribe from color scheme changes triggered by external events
unsubscribe.name: func

clear.description: Function to clear value from external storage
clear.name: func

defaultColorScheme.description: Default color scheme value used when `colorSchemeManager` cannot retrieve value from external storage, `light` by default

forceColorScheme.description: Forces color scheme value, if set, MantineProvider ignores `colorSchemeManager` and `defaultColorScheme`

cssVariablesSelector.description: CSS selector to which CSS variables should be added, `:root` by default

withCssVariables.description: Determines whether theme CSS variables should be added to given `cssVariablesSelector`, `true` by default

deduplicateCssVariables.description: Determines whether CSS variables should be deduplicated: if CSS variable has the same value as in default theme, it is not added in the runtime. `true` by default.

getRootElement.description: Function to resolve root element to set `data-mantine-color-scheme` attribute, must return undefined on server, `() => document.documentElement` by default

classNamesPrefix.description: A prefix for components static classes (for example {selector}-Text-root), `mantine` by default

getStyleNonce.description: Function to generate nonce attribute added to all generated `<style />` tags

cssVariablesResolver.description: Function to generate CSS variables based on theme object

withStaticClasses.description: Determines whether components should have static classes, for example, `mantine-Button-root`. `true` by default

withGlobalClasses.description: Determines whether global classes should be added with `<style />` tag. Global classes are required for `hiddenFrom`/`visibleFrom` and `lightHidden`/`darkHidden` props to work. `true` by default.

stylesTransform.description: An object to transform `styles` and `sx` props into css classes, can be used with CSS-in-JS libraries
